intro: Diascia tysonii, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features succulent, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Diascia tysonii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
